intro: Oxymitra staudtii, commonly known as the Staudt's oxymitra, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Oxymitra staudtii is considered a rare and endangered species.
